regions.name: as923
regions.label: AS923
regions.title: AS920-923 and AS923-925 uplink and downlink
regions.countries: These data rates are used with different frequencies, depending on the country. AS920-923 MHz ("AS1") is used in Japan, Malaysia and Singapore. AS923-925 MHz ("AS2") is used in Brunei, Cambodia, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Laos, Taiwan, Thailand and Vietnam. Australia uses [both AS1 and AS2, next to AU915](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/can-australian-users-agree-on-using-a-single-frequency-plan/17660).
regions.limitations:
For AS923, the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters 1.0.2 Rev B as used by the TTN community network, state that devices should assume a maximum [uplink dwell time of 400 milliseconds](https://lora-alliance.org/sites/default/files/2018-05/lorawan_regional_parameters_v1.0.2_final_1944_1.pdf#page=38) until the network server disables that using the `TxParamSetupReq` command. When used in Australia, a post in the TTN Forum suggests that maximum dwell times [may not apply](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/36601/6). A LoRaWAN-imposed maximum duty cycle of 1% applies to ([only](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/37924)) the 2 default channels, 923.20 and 923.40 MHz. Like for any region, SF11 and SF12 [are only allowed when ADR is enabled](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/can-i-register-an-abp-device-that-has-fixed-devaddr-nwkskey-and-appskey/3831/16).

Please, feel free to create an issue or pull request [for this description](https://github.com/avbentem/airtime-calculator/blob/master/public/config.json).

regions.name: au915
regions.label: AU915
regions.title: AU915-928 uplink
regions.countries: AU915-928 is used in Argentina, Australia (which also [uses AS923](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/can-australian-users-agree-on-using-a-single-frequency-plan/17660)), Brazil, Chile and New Zealand.
regions.limitations:
For AU915-928, the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters 1.0.2 Rev B as used by the TTN community network, [define no dwell time limitations](https://lora-alliance.org/sites/default/files/2018-05/lorawan_regional_parameters_v1.0.2_final_1944_1.pdf#page=28). However, 1.0.3 states that devices should assume a maximum [uplink dwell time of 400 milliseconds](https://lora-alliance.org/sites/default/files/2018-07/lorawan_regional_parameters_v1.0.3reva_0.pdf#page=37) until the network server disables that using the `TxParamSetupReq` command, just like for AS923 in 1.0.2 Rev B. A post in the TTN Forum suggests that maximum dwell times [may not apply for Australia](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/36601/6). Like for any region, SF11 and SF12 [are only allowed when ADR is enabled](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/can-i-register-an-abp-device-that-has-fixed-devaddr-nwkskey-and-appskey/3831/16).

Please, feel free to create an issue or pull request [for this description](https://github.com/avbentem/airtime-calculator/blob/master/public/config.json).

regions.name: au915-dl
regions.label: AU915 DL
regions.title: AU915-928 downlink
regions.limitations: See the countries and limitations described in AU915.

regions.name: cn470
regions.label: CN470
regions.title: CN470-510 uplink and downlink
regions.limitations: For CN470-510, the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters 1.0.2 Rev B as used by the TTN community network, describe there is [no dwell time limitation](https://lora-alliance.org/sites/default/files/2018-05/lorawan_regional_parameters_v1.0.2_final_1944_1.pdf#page=33), and do not mention any maximum duty cycle either. Like for any region, SF11 and SF12 [are only allowed when ADR is enabled](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/can-i-register-an-abp-device-that-has-fixed-devaddr-nwkskey-and-appskey/3831/16).

regions.name: eu868
regions.label: EU868
regions.title: EU863-870 uplink and downlink
regions.countries: EU863-870 is used in Albania, Andorra, Angola, Austria, Bahrain, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Botswana, Bulgaria, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Eswatini (formerly Swaziland), Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lesotho, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Malawi, Malta, Mauritius, Moldova, Montenegro, Mozambique, Namibia, The Netherlands, North Macedonia, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Serbia, Seychelles, Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Tanzania, Turkey, United Arab Emirates (UAE), United Kingdom (UK), Vatican City (Holy See), Zambia and Zimbabwe.
regions.limitations: For EU863-870, the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters 1.0.2 Rev B as used by the TTN community network, [define duty-cycled limited transmissions](https://lora-alliance.org/sites/default/files/2018-05/lorawan_regional_parameters_v1.0.2_final_1944_1.pdf#page=8) to comply with the European Telecommunications Standards Institute (ETSI) regulations. In ETSI, most bands use a maximum duty cycle of 1%, but some use 0.1% and 10%. Like for any region, SF11 and SF12 [are only allowed when ADR is enabled](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/can-i-register-an-abp-device-that-has-fixed-devaddr-nwkskey-and-appskey/3831/16).

regions.name: in865
regions.label: IN865
regions.title: IN865-867 uplink and downlink
regions.limitations: For IN865-867, the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters 1.0.2 Rev B as used by the TTN community network, [state](https://lora-alliance.org/sites/default/files/2018-05/lorawan_regional_parameters_v1.0.2_final_1944_1.pdf#page=48) that neither dwell time nor duty-cycle limitations apply. Like for any region, SF11 and SF12 [are only allowed when ADR is enabled](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/can-i-register-an-abp-device-that-has-fixed-devaddr-nwkskey-and-appskey/3831/16).

regions.name: kr920
regions.label: KR920
regions.title: KR920-923 uplink and downlink
regions.countries: KR920-923 is used in South Korea.
regions.limitations: For KR920-923, the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters 1.0.2 Rev B as used by the TTN community network, [mandate](https://lora-alliance.org/sites/default/files/2018-05/lorawan_regional_parameters_v1.0.2_final_1944_1.pdf#page=43) that Listen Before Talk Adaptive Frequency Agility (LBT AFA) is used. Hence, neither dwell time nor duty cycle limitations apply. Like for any region, SF11 and SF12 [are only allowed when ADR is enabled](https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/forum/t/can-i-register-an-abp-device-that-has-fixed-devaddr-nwkskey-and-appskey/3831/16).

regions.name: us915
regions.label: US915
regions.title: US902-928 uplink
regions.countries: US902-928 is used in Bolivia, Canada, Colombia, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Guyana, Mexico, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Puerto Rico, Suriname, United States of America (USA), Uruguay and Venezuela.
regions.limitations: For US902-928, the LoRaWAN Regional Parameters 1.0.2 Rev B as used by the TTN community network, [describe](https://lora-alliance.org/sites/default/files/2018-05/lorawan_regional_parameters_v1.0.2_final_1944_1.pdf#page=13) that FCC regulations impose a maximum dwell time of 400 milliseconds on uplinks. That makes SF11BW125 and SF12BW125 not suitable for any payload size.

regions.name: us915-dl
regions.label: US915 DL
regions.title: US902-928 downlink
regions.limitations: See the countries and limitations described in US915.
